Text: Groups of Traditional Buildings (伝統的建造物群 , Dentōteki Kenzōbutsu-gun ) is a Japanese category of historic preservation introduced by a 1975 amendment of the law which mandates the protection of groups of traditional buildings which, together with their environment, form a beautiful scene.
Triplets:<Groups of Traditional Buildings
1:
--------------------
Text: Groups of Traditional Buildings:  They can be post towns, castle towns, mining towns, merchant quarters, ports, farming or fishing villages, etc.

post towns, castle towns, mining towns
